intro: Desmostemon, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to southern and eastern Africa. The plants are herbaceous, with opposite leaves that are often lobed or serrated. They produce yellow flowers that are typically arranged in a head, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Desmostemon species are often found in grasslands and open woodlands, where they thrive in well-drained soils.
